intro: Tephrosia chrysophylla var. gracilior, commonly known as the slender tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant features delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its habitat. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its botanical structure includes trifoliate leaves and stipules, which are common traits among members of the legume family.
